Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Raghuram Rajan has been appointed Governor of the Bank of England.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on viral social media posts and individual users' messages without any official confirmation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Raghuram Rajan has been appointed as the Governor of the Bank of England without any concrete evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that Raghuram Rajan is one of the contenders for the position but has not been appointed yet.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the news of Raghuram Rajan's appointment by presenting it as a fact without any verified information.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting unverified information as factual news.
